Lars Clausen wrote:

> As mentioned before, we've made a new QueueAssignmentPolicy by
> overriding getClassKey().  However, it is not obvious what the method
> should do if given invalid input.  The result is used unchecked, leading
> to exceptions later on if the returned key is null.  We actually check
> that the key given contains a valid domain name or IP address, and so
> would like to be able to reject malformed keys.  What should be done to
> reject a key?

HostnameQAP catches exceptions and returns a 'special ' class name : 
http://crawler.archive.org/xref/org/archive/crawler/frontier/HostnameQueueAssignmentPolicy.html#48.  
You might do the same.  Maybe the API should be changed to allow 
throwing of an exception?

St.Ack

>
> -Lars
